meanings.definition: A person or thing that inches.
meanings.sent1: The slow inchers finally reached the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The inchers carefully moved the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The inchers inched their way through the maze, taking their time.
meanings.sent4: The inchers in the race were like turtles compared to the sprinters.
meanings.sent5: The inchers in the group always took the longest to complete tasks.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: She measured the table using inches and found it was 36 inchers long.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter marked the wood every few inchers before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The inchers on the ruler seemed to shrink when she wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: The inchers on the tape measure were like tiny markers along the length.
meanings.sent5: He estimated the length to be around 10 inchers, but it was actually 12.
